result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

Stipulation and proposed order to seal exhibit
9/15/22, Preliminary Hearing;  Meredith Seymour, Court Reporter

11:16 AM Defendant Dominic Xavier Morris Simmons Jr in court.  Attorney Payal Khandhar in court for Dominic Xavier Morris Simmons Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Lennon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Madison Police Detective J. J., duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA Lennon. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty Khandhar. Redirect exam by ADA Lennon. Witness excused. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over. Argument by Atty Khandhar. CT doesn't find PC this defn committed a felony. CT amends charge to Misd. Disorderly Conduct.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JCF except only for incidental contact while at school. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards JCF. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 7

9:18 AM Defendant Dominic Xavier Morris Simmons Jr in court.  Attorney Payal Khandhar in court for Dominic Xavier Morris Simmons Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
